turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I need help with a claim. My basement flooded last night and it's a mess. I'm really stressed out right now.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I'm very sorry to hear about the flooding in your basement. That sounds like a difficult situation. I can certainly help you start the claim process. To begin, could you please provide your policy number?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, my policy number is HO1234567. I reported it online already, but it feels like nothing is happening. How quickly can someone actually come out to look at the damage? And will you cover preventative work needed on the house now, like fixing the drain that caused it, or just the stuff that got ruined?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you for providing your policy number. Your online report has been received. An adjuster will be assigned to your claim to assess the damage. Response times can vary based on claim volume and location, but we strive to address claims promptly. Regarding preventative work, insurance primarily covers sudden and accidental damage. We will assess the damage to your basement and covered contents based on your policy terms.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Promptly? That doesn't really tell me much. So you *won't* help fix the actual problem, just the resulting damage? That seems... unhelpful in preventing future issues. What's the *average* time frame I should expect before someone contacts me or visits?
